turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Are you there? Miles?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, I'm here.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm sorry, Miles. We did all we could. You've been a real trooper.  Tell him I'll call back.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So I guess that's it.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You're a wonderful writer, Miles. Don't be discouraged.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Hey, Miles. Long time no see.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Gary.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: When's that novel of yours coming out?  We  all want to read it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Soon, soon. Say, this is my buddy Jack. He's getting married next week.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: My condolences.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What are you pouring tonight?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Lot of good stuff.  Got the new Bien Nacido. Want a taste?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Absolutement.  They have their own label that's just outstanding.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Tight as a nun's asshole but qood concentration. Nice fruit.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: How's it hanging, Miles?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You know me. I love it up here. How about you?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Busy night for a Tuesday. We had a busload of retired folks in on a wine tour. Usually they're not too rowdy, but tonight there was something going on. Full moon or something. What can I get you?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Highliner.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Glass or bottle?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Bottle.

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Say, is Maya working?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: Maya? Haven't seen her. I think she's off tonight. Say, where's your buddy?

turns.speaker: GARY
turns.text: You okay, Miles?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'm good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They're from both of us.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: A famous actor bringing me flowers on my birthday. Don't I feel special?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jeez, Mrs. Raymond, that was eleven years ago.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: Well, you were wonderful on that show. I never understood why they had to give you that brain tumor so soon. Why that didn't make you the biggest movie star in the world is a sin. It's a sin.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, well, you should be my agent.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: If I was, I would sing your praises up and down the street until they put me in the loony bin. Now Miles, why didn't you tell me you were coming and bringing this handsome man? Look how I'm dressed. I've got to run and put my face on.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You look fabulous, Mrs. Raymond.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: Oh, stop it. Make yourselves comfortable.  You boys hungry?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Mrs. Raymond, this is delicious. Absolutely delicious.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: They're just leftovers.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is it chicken?

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: I could have made something fancier if a certain someone had let me know that a certain someone was coming for a visit with a certain special friend. Could have made a pork roast.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: And what was that other one you did, the one where you're the jogger?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, that was for, uh, wait... That was for Spray and Wash.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: Spray and Wash. That's the one.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, I remember the girl who was in it with me. She was something.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: I just remember you jogging. So when's the wedding?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Two years ago, buddy.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: You should get back together with Victoria. She was good for you.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: She was good for you.  And so beautiful and intelligent. You knew her, right?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, yeah. Real well. Still do.

turns.speaker: PHYLLIS
turns.text: I'm worried about you, Miles. Do you need some money?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Hey, guys. How's it going?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Excellent. My friend and I are up here doing the wine tour, and he tells me that you folks make one hell of a Syrah.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: That's what people say.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Now there's a girl who knows how to pour. What's your name?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Stephanie.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tastes good to me. You live around here, Stephanie?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: In Santa Ynez.  And I agree with you about Cab Franc.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh yeah? We're just over in Buellton. Windmill Inn.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know a gal named Maya? Works at the Hitching Post?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Sure I know Maya. Real well.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No shit. We just had a drink with her last night. Miles knows her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're a bad, bad girl, Stephanie.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: I know. I might need to be spanked.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How you doin' tonight, beautiful?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Good. How're you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Great. You look great.  You both do.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Not so bad yourself.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: I'm thinking about the duck breast.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: What happened to you guys?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Couple of wrong turns.  Thanks to Magellan, here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Hi.  Maya's in the kitchen.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I can explain.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: You said you loved me! You fuck! I hope you die!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hiya.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Hi. Well, nice to see you guys here. Bye, Miles.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Highliner, please.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's on us.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Are you a writer too?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, I'm an actor.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Oh yeah? What kind of stuff?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A lot of TV. I was a regular on a couple of series. And lately I've been doing a lot of commercials. National mostly.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Anything I'd know?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Maybe. Recognize this?

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: That's hilarious. You sound just like one of those guys.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I am one of those guys.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: You are not.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whatever you girls want. It's on us tonight. Sky's the limit.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: No, we're paying for the wine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't think so. We're celebrating Miles's book deal.

turns.speaker: MAYA
turns.text: Well, in that case...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where the fuck were you, man? I was dying in there. We were supposed to be a hundred miles away by now.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I can't help the traffic.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come on. You're fucking hungover.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Okay, there was a tasting last night. But I wanted to get us some stuff for the ride up. Check out the box.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Why did you tell them my book was being published?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You said you had it all lined up.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: No, I didn't. What I said was that my agent had heard there was some interest at Conundrum...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, Conundrum.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: ...and that one of the editors was passing it up to a senior editor. She was supposed to hear something this week, but now it's next week, and... It's always like this. It's always a fucking waiting game. I've been through it too many times already.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know. Senior editor? Sounds like you're in to me.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: It's a long shot, all right? And Conundrum is just a small specialty press anyway. I'm not getting my hopes up. I've stopped caring. That's it. I've stopped caring.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Don't open that now. It's warm.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come on, we're celebrating. I say we pop it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That's a 1992 Byron. It's really rare. Don't open it now. I've been saving it!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shut up.  Here's to a great week.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yes. Absolutely. Despite your crass behavior, I'm really glad we're finally getting this time together.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You know how long I've been begging to take you on the wine tour. I was beginning to think it was never going to happen.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, that's tasty.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: 100% Pinot Noir. Single vineyard. They don't even make it anymore.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pinot Noir? How come it's white? Doesn't noir mean dark?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Jesus. Don't ask questions like that up in the wine country. They'll think you're a moron.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just tell me.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Color in the red wines comes from the skins. This juice is free run, so there's no skin contact in the fermentation, ergo no color.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure is tasty.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Did you read the latest draft, by the way?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, yeah. Yeah.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I liked it a lot. A lot of improvements. It just seemed overall, I don't know, tighter, more... congealed or something.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: How about the new ending? Did you like that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh yeah. Much better.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: There is no new ending. Page 750 on is exactly the same.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, then I guess it must have felt new because everything leading up to it was so different.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whoa, why are we getting off?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I've just got to make one quick stop. Won't take a second.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I thought we could just say a quick hello to my mother.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Your mother? Jesus, Miles, we were supposed to be up there hours ago.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: It's her birthday tomorrow. And I don't feel right driving by her house and not stopping in, okay? It'll just take a second. She's right off the freeway.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How old's she going to be?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Um... seventy... something.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's a good age.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Let me show you something. The secret to opening champagne is that once the cork is released, you keep pressure on it so you don't --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just a second. Guy's going for $2500.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: This Saturday, Mom, remember? We told you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And Miles is my best man, Mrs. Raymond. My main man.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fuck, man. Too early in the morning for that, you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She's a kid, Jack. I don't even look at that stuff anymore.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's your problem, Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: As if she'd even be attracted to guys like us in the first place.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Speak for yourself. I get chicks looking at me all the time. All ages.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: It's not worth it. You pay too big a price. It's never free.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It'd be the best thing for you. You know what? I'm going to get you laid this week. That's going to be my best man gift to you. I'm not going to give you a pen knife or a gift certificate or any of that other horseshit.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'd rather have a knife.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No. No. You've been officially depressed for like two years now, and you were always a negative guy anyway, even in college. Now it's worse -- you're wasting away. Teaching English to fucking eighth-graders when they should be reading what you wrote. Your books.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'm working on it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You still seeing that shrink?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I went on Monday. But I spent most of the time helping him with his computer.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, I say fuck therapy and what's that stuff you take, Xanax?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And Lexapro, yes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, I say fuck that. You need to get your joint worked on, that's what you need.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Jack. This week is not about me. It's about you. I'm going to show you a good time. We're going to drink a lot of good wine, play some golf, eat some great food, enjoy the scenery and send you off in style.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And get your bone smooched.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You know what? Let's take the Santa Rosa turnoff and hit Sanford first.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whatever's closest, man. I need a glass.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: These guys make top-notch Pinot and Chardonnay. One of the best producers in Santa Barbara county.  Look how beautiful this view is. What a day!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I thought you hated Chardonnay.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I like all varietals. I just don't generally like the way they manipulate Chardonnay in California -- too much oak and secondary malolactic fermentation.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey, Miles. I really hope your novel sells.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Thanks, Jack. So do I.  Here we are.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So what'd you guys finally decide on for the menu?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I told you. Filet and salmon.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, but how are they making the salmon? Poached with a yogurt-dill sauce? Teriyaki? Curry?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know. Salmon. Don't you always have white wine with fish?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh, Jesus. Look, at some point we have to find out because it's going to make a big difference.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let me call Christine.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Doesn't have to be now. Let's go taste.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I owe her a call anyway.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Baked with a butter-lime glaze.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Now we're talking.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is rose, right?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Good, yeah, it is a rose. Only this one is rather atypically made from 100% Pinot Noir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pinot noir? Not again!  You know, not all Pinots are noir.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: First take your glass and examine the wine against the light. You're looking at color and clarity.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What color is it supposed to be?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Depends on the varietal. Just get a sense of it. Thick? Thin? Watery? Syrupy? Inky? Amber, whatever...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Now tip it. What you're doing here is checking for color density as it thins toward the rim. Tells you how old it is, among other things, usually more important with reds. This is a very young wine, so it's going to retain its color pretty solidly. Now stick your nose in it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What do you smell?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know. Wine? Fermented grapes?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Huh. Maybe a little strawberry. Yeah, strawberry. I'm not so sure about the cheese.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Now set your glass down and get some air into it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That's what you do with every one.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: When do we get to drink it?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How would you rate this one?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Usually they start you on the wines with learning disabilities, but this one's pretty damn good.  This is the new one, right, Chris?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know, you could work in a wine store.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, that would be a good move.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Are you chewing gum?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Want some?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hey Jack, hurry up!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just a minute!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I thought you said it was close. Now I'm all pitted out.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: It's not even a mile.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We should have driven.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Not with the wine list these people have. We don't want to hold back.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You think I'm making a mistake marrying Christine?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Whoa.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come on, do you think I'm doing the right thing? Tell the truth. You've been through it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, you waited for good reason, and you proposed to Christine for some good reason. So I think it's great. It's time. You've got to have your eyes open, that's all. I mean, look at me. I thought Victoria and I were set for life.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Christine's dad -- he's been talking about bringing me into his property business. Showing me the ropes. And that's something, considering how long it took him to get over I'm not Armenian. So I'm thinking about it. But I don't know, might get a little incestuous. But Mike does pretty well. A lot of high-end commercial stuff.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So you're going to stop acting?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No way. This would just provide some stability is what I'm saying. I can always squeeze in an audition or a commercial here and there, you know, keep myself in the game in case something big comes along.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We're not getting any younger, right? And my career, well, it's gotten pretty, you know, frustrating. Even with my new manager. Maybe it's time to settle down.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: If that's what feels right.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It does. Feels right.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Then it's a good thing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah. It's good. Feels good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah. Tight.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Pour us a couple.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Here's to my last week of freedom.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: It's going to be great. Here's to us.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh, yeah. That's Maya.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know her?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Sure I know Maya.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know that chick?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Jack, this is where I eat when I come up here. It's practically my office. And sometimes I have a drink with the employees. Maya's great. She's worked here about a year, maybe a year and a half.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She is very hot.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And very nice. And very married. Check out the rock.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Doesn't mean shit. When Christine was a hostess at Sushi Roku, she wore a big engagement ring to keep guys from hitting on her. Think it worked? Fuck no. How do you think I met her?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: This gal's married to I think a Philosophy professor at UC Santa Barbara.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So what's a professor's wife doing waitressing? Obviously that's over.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You don't know anything about this woman. Calm down. Let's just eat, okay?  The duck is excellent and pairs nicely with the Highliner Pinot.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jesus, she's jammin'. And she likes you. What else do you know about her?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, she does know a lot about wine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ooooooohh. Now we're getting somewhere.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And she likes Pinot.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Perfect.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Jack, she's a fucking waitress in Buellton. How would that ever work?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why do you always focus on the negative? Didn't you see how friendly she was to you?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She works for tips!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're blind, dude. Blind.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The girl is looking to party, and you tell her we're going to go back to our motel room and crash? Jesus, Miles!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, I'm tired. Aren't you tired?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The chick digs you. She lit up like a pinball machine when she heard your novel was getting published.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Now I've got another lie to live down. Thanks, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm trying to get you some action, but you've got to help me out just a little bit.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Didn't seem to me like that's what was going on. You were all over her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Somebody had to do the talking. And by the way, I was right. She's not married.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No rock. When she came to the bar, sans rock.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Single. Waitress. Getting off work. Looking for love. A little slap and tickle.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She probably went home, lit some candles, put on some relaxing music, took a nice hot bath, and laid down on her bed with her favorite vibrator.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Have you no shame?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oooh. Oh. Miles. Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So what're we going to have? Pigs in a blanket? The "rancher's special breakfast"? Or maybe just some grease and fat with a side of lard?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So what's the plan today?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: We head north, begin the grape tour up there, make our way south so the more we drink the closer we get to the motel.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I am going to get my nut on this trip, Miles. And you are not going to fuck it up for me with all your depression and anxiety and neg-head downer shit.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Ooooh, now the cards are on the table.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes they are. And I'm serious. Do not fuck with me. I am going to get laid before I settle down on Saturday. Do you read me?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Sure, big guy. Whatever you say. It's your party. I'm sorry I'm in the way and dragging you down. Maybe you'd have a better time on your own. You take the car. I'll catch the train back.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, see, I want both of us to get crazy. We should both be cutting loose. I mean, this is our last chance. This is our week! It should be something we share.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Nice, huh?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Beautiful.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Victoria and I used to like this view.  Once we had a picnic here and drank a '95 Opus One. With smoked salmon and artichokes, but we didn't care.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She has the best palate of any woman I've ever known. She could even differentiate Italian wines.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Miles, I gotta tell you something. Victoria's coming to the wedding.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I know. You told me. I'm okay with it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, but that's not the whole story. She got remarried.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She what?  When?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: About a month ago. Six weeks.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: To that guy? That guy with the restaurant...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Miles. Get out!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I want to go home now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You've been divorced for two years already. People move on. She has! It's like you enjoy self-pity. Makes you feel special or something.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Is she bringing him to the wedding?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You drop this bombshell on me. Why didn't you tell me before?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because I knew you'd freak out and probably get so depressed you wouldn't even come on this trip. But then I figured here would be the best place to tell you. We're here to forget about all that shit. We're here to party!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'm going to be a fucking pariah. Everyone's just going to be holding their breath to see if I'm going to get drunk and make a scene. Plus Tony fucking Levin?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, no, no. It's cool. I talked to Victoria. She's cool. Everyone's cool.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You've all been talking about it? Behind my back? Talking about it?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You gotta excuse him. Yesterday he didn't know Pinot Noir from film noir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm a quick learner.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A bad girl, Miles. She might need to be spanked.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Do you know how often these pourers get hit on?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get the trunk.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You have the keys.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We're on.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She called Maya, who's not working tonight, so we're all going out.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: With Maya?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Been divorced for a year now, bud.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Stephanie, holy shit. Chick had it all going on.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, she is cute.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Cute? She's a fucking hottie. And you almost tell her I'm getting married. What's the matter with you?  Gotta love it. Gotta love it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know how often these pourers get hit on?  I'm going for a swim. Get the blood flowing. Want to come?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Nah. I want to watch this.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So what should I wear?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know. Casual but nice. They think you're a writer.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please just try to be your normal humorous self, okay? Like who you were before the tailspin. Do you remember that guy? People love that guy. And don't forget -- your novel is coming out in the fall.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh yeah? How exciting. What's it called?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do not sabotage me. If you want to be a lightweight, that's your call. But do not sabotage me.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Aye-aye, captain.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And if they want to drink Merlot, we're drinking Merlot.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: If anyone orders Merlot, I'm leaving. I am not drinking any fucking Merlot!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay, okay. Relax, Miles, Jesus. No Merlot. Did you bring your Xanax?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And don't drink too much. I don't want you going to the dark side or passing out. Do you hear me? No going to the dark side.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Okay! Fuck!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pull yourself together, man.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'm fine!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Bathroom.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did you drink and dial?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Stop it. You are blowing a great opportunity here, Miles. Fucking Maya, man. She's great. She's cool. She's funny. She knows wine. What is this morose come-down bullshit? These girls want to party. And what was that fucking ten-minute lecture on, what was it, Vouvrays? I mean, come on!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Let's just say I'm uncomfortable with the whole scenario.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh Jesus, Miles.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And don't forget all the bad times you had with Victoria. How small she make you feel. That's why you had the affair in the first place.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Shut up. Shut your face.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't you see how Maya's looking at you? You got her on the hook. Reel her in! Come on, let's rachet this up a notch. You know how to to do it. Here.  Drink some agua.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Goddamn, Miles, she is nasty. Nasty nasty nasty.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Well, I'm glad you got it out of your system. Congratulations. Mission accomplished.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, hey, change of plans. Steph's off today, so she and I are going on a hike.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: We were supposed to play golf.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You go. In fact, use my clubs. They're brand new -- gift from Christine's dad.  It's on me. Oh, say, by the way, Stephanie and me were thinking we'd all go to the Hitching Post tonight and sit at one of Maya's tables, and she'll bring us some great wines and then we can all --

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Count me out.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oooh, I see. Didn't go so good last night, huh? That's a shocker. You mean getting drunk and calling Victoria didn't put you in the mood? You dumb fuck. Your divorce pain's getting real old real fast, dude.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Later.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, well, maybe you should check your messages first.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, boy.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: She's been leaving messages here too.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah. Okay.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You should call her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I will.  See ya!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Right now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay! Jesus!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What'd Christine say?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Lucked out -- got voice mail. Everything's cool.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey, there you are.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What're you drinking?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Where is Stephanie?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Upstairs. Getting cleaned up.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What the fuck are you doing?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: With this chick.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Does she know about Saturday?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Um... not exactly. But I've been honest. I haven't told her I'm available. And she knows this trip up here is only for a few days. Besides...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Besides what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well... I don't know, just... the wedding.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, I've been doing some thinking.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Oh, you've been thinking. And?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I may have to put the wedding on hold is all.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Being with Stephanie has opened my eyes. She's not uptight or controlling. She's just cool. Things are so easy with her. Smells different. Tastes different. Fucks different. Fucks like an animal. I'm telling you, I went deep last night, Miles. Deep.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Deep.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was hoping to get some understanding from you. And I'm not getting it.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Understanding of what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Like I might be in love with another woman.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: In love? Twenty-four hours with some wine-pourer chick and you think you're in love? And give up everything?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look who's talking. You've been there.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yes I have, and do I look like a happy man? Was all that drama with Brenda a happy thing for me to do? Huh? Was it? Is she a part of my life now?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is totally different. I'm talking about avoiding what you're talking about. That's the distinction. I have not made the commitment yet. I am not married. I have not said the words. In a few days, I might get married, and if I do, then I won't be doing stuff like this anymore. Otherwise, what's the whole point of getting married?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And what about Stephanie? She's a woman -- with a kid. A single mom. What do you think she's looking for? Huh?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Here's what I'm thinking. We move up here, you and me, buy a vineyard. You design your own wine; I'll handle the business side. Then you get inspired and write a new novel. As for me, if an audition comes along, hell, LA'S two hours away. Not even.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You're crazy. You've gone crazy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you care anyway? You don't even like Christine.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What? Of course I like Christine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You said she was shallow. Yeah, and a nouveau riche.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That was three years ago after that first party!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, Miles, all I know is I'm an actor. All I have is my instinct.  My intuition -- that's all I have. And you're asking me to go against it. And that's just wrong.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen, I'm going to make sure Steph and Siena get home safe, and then maybe we'll hook up with you later, okay?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Sure, whatever. Maybe I'll catch a movie.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Call me on my cell if you go out.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: That's a public course.  No Stephanie?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She's working. I need a break anyway. She's getting a little clingy.  This is our day!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did you ever got ahold of Maya yesterday?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She likes you, man. Stephanie'll tell you.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Can you give me some room here?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh yeah. Sure.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know, in life you gotta strike when the iron's hot.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Thanks, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice shot.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You're an asshole.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What about your agent? Hear anything yet?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you think's going on?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Could be anything.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Been checking your messages?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Obsessively.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: They probably think my book is such a piece of shit that it's not even worthy of a response. I guess I'll just have to learn how to kiss off three years of my life.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But you don't know yet, so your negativity's a bit premature, wouldn't you say?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't come over the top. Stay still.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just trying to be helpful.  It's all about stillness, Miles. Inner quiet.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Shut up! Shut up! Shut up! What's the matter with you, man? SHUT UP!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why are you so hostile? I know you're frustrated with your life right now, but you can choose not to be so hostile.  Here.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know. Got it from Stephanie.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Fucker hit into us.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey, asshole! That's not cool!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Throw me his ball.
